title: Handy Hints for the home by Lyn Rumble

garlic-strength.title: GARLIC STRENGTH
pars: Add garlic immediately to a recipe if you want a subtle taste and towards the end to blast it with flavour.

reheating-pizza.title: REHEATING PIZZA
pars: To reheat a pizza so that the base is out-of-theoven crisp, heat your leftover slices in a fry pan on low-medium heat on the stove until warm and wave goodbye to the days of soggy microwave pizza.

vacuum-tool.title: QUICK FIX VACUUM TOOL
pars: To suck up hard-to-reach gunk under your fridge or behind a bookshelf, insert an empty paper towel roll into the end of your vacuum cleaner and bend, or flatten it, to squeeze into these difficult spots.

bananas.title: BANANAS
pars: Pull bananas apart before displaying them in your fruit bowl. If you leave them connected at the stem, they’ll ripen faster and go brown quicker. Who knew?

lipstick-stains.title: LIPSTICK STAINS
pars: Oops - got lipstick on your clothes? WD40 will remove the stain with a quick squirt.

zippers-1.title: Zippers
pars: If your zipper is not gliding up and down the teeth well, rub the lead of a graphite pencil across and up and down the teeth for about an inch below the problem area a few times. Slide zip down onto graphite coverage and up and down a few times. This should help the gliding and work well again.

zippers-2.title: More Zippers
pars: If the end clamp has been lost on your zipper, use a stapler and put two staples across the end of the teeth where you want the end to be. This should hold it well until able to repair properly.

rubberband.title: Rubberband
pars: If your photo in the photo frame keeps sliding and not straight – place two rubber bands on top of the photo, then the frame base plate and fasten. The rubber will grip the frame base and the photo will not move.

screw-head-slip.title: Screw head slipping in cavity
pars: If when you try to tighten up a screw and the screwdriver head just slips in the cavity – place a wide elastic band over the cavity and reinsert your screwdriver. The screwdriver should grip tightly in the cavity making it easy for you to tighten or unscrew as required.

pool-noodles.title: Pool noodles
pars: If you don’t like the line on your clothes when you hang them across the airer to dry in the house over winter, slice open one side of a length of pool noodle, the length of your clothes dryer, and put over the bar – then hang the clothes- hey presto no crease line.

oven-drip-tray.title: Oven drip tray
pars: Using aluminium foil, cut a length to suit your oven and line the bottom. It’s economical and can be replaced easily when dirty - plus saves you cleaning!

blunt-scissors.title: Blunt scissors
pars: Cut a piece of folded aluminium foil several times and then cut through it with the scissors - this should help to re-sharpen the scissors.

lemon-juice.title: Lemon juice
pars: Need to juice a lemon easily? Get a lemon and roll it on the kitchen counter top with palm of your hand until lemon gets a bit softer. Get a metal skewer and insert into one end to make a small hole and remove. Squirt your lemon juice into your dish or bowl as required; nice and clean and easy.

frozen-butter.title: Butter too frozen to spread
pars: Grate a piece of your slab of butter, and then use the grated butter to spread on your bread or toast as needed.

burnt-frying-pan.title: Burnt nonstick frying pan
pars: Boil three parts water and one part vinegar in the pan for about ten minutes. Allow the solution to cool and then scrub the pot with warm, soapy water and a soft cloth. Add vinegar to the suds for particularly stubborn stains.
